definition: to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Sceptics point out that due process requires discretion.
sentences.chinese: 懷疑派則指出應該謹慎推行公開化。

sentences.english: Although there is no small favors, but the price open, product quality is not bad.
sentences.chinese: 雖然沒有小恩小惠，但價格公開化，商品質量還不錯。

sentences.english: It typically explodes into the open at some point.
sentences.chinese: 它通常會在某個時間點上突然公開化。

sentences.english: And this semi-public link to the broader net leaves vital systems potentially open to attack.
sentences.chinese: 這種半公開化的寬帶連接讓重要的系統容易受到襲擊。

sentences.english: That opened up in public the possibility that the currency union might not be forever.
sentences.chinese: 此舉將歐元區不會永遠存續的可能性公開化了。

sentences.english: Recent developments in the area have brought latent ethnic tension out into the open .
sentences.chinese: 這個地區最近的事態發展使潛在的民族矛盾公開化了。

sentences.english: There are divisions within NATO on that that have become public.
sentences.chinese: 北約內部對此存在分歧，現在分歧已經公開化。

sentences.english: We see perestroika leading to glasnost.
sentences.chinese: 我們看到改革向公開化邁進。
